_source.text: After a mix of natural disasters and spiking energy prices dampened growth in the first half of the year, the housing number "was one sliver of economic data that we've had in recent months that was actually better than expected," said Stuart Hoffman, chief economist at PNC Financial Services Group in Pittsburgh.
